p: Furthermore, we also explored LINC00466/miR-137/PPP1R14B axis on the biological function of glioma cells. CCK8 and transwell assays revealed that silencing PPP1R14B and overexpression of miR-137 could suppress the promotion of proliferation and metastasis of glioma cells by up-regulation of LINC00466 ( Figure 6A, C and D). The impaction of LINC00466/miR-137/PPP1R14B axis on the sensitivity of glioma cell to TMZ showed LINC00466 and PPP1R14B could promote the resistance of glioma cell to TMZ. The results of miR-137 were opposite ( Figure 6B). Taken together, these findings suggested LINC00466 might promoted the expression of PPP1R14B to regulate cell activity and resistance to TMZ treatment of glioma cells by competitively binding to miR-137.
